reviews.review: Great movie! Hits all the right points. The story of Thanos is paramount to this movie. The Russos has served their purpose in bringing this movie to the masses.
Wow! I didnâ€™t think they would do it!

It's the build up of a build up that doesn't build up any tension whatsoever. The jokes and the many stories make the fact that the Universe is about to collapse, completely overshadowed. Great SFX, great cast as always. Terrible writing.

Avengers: Infinity War doesn't quite live up to the hype, but is a solid Marvel movie nonetheless.  The strongest aspect of this movie is Brolin's performance as Thanos, who brings a spectacular example of character complexity.  The sheer scope of this movie is also impressive, with an unprecedented all-star cast coming together.  The downside begins as a different side of that coin, however, as none of the characters in this movie are as compelling as they are in their stand-alone titles.  Despite other critics indicating the contrary, the heroes really do get in each others' way at times.  A decent plot progresses well into a multi-part story, although the big "deaths" at the end do not feel genuine and thus lose their dramatic impetus.
This movie felt like it was ten years in the making. If you have watched every MCU movie since 2008 then this movie really was the ultimate payoff. Definitely see this in the theater!

The film does try to squeeze in some romance plots; which are either so similar or so minor that they just appear to be filler more than anything else. I also will mention that the Infinity Gauntlet is inconsistent with being too underpower and too overpowered; it goes back and forth so much. If it is indeed so overpowered; then Thanos must be a thundering dumbass for not using it to its fullest extent in battle.

I will say it is still a solid Marvel film otherwise. While the length is long, the pacing is good and the fights are good. What really impressed me was the 'Team Ironman' duel with Thanos; it was both smart, brutal and well executed.
